nodes.text: The lakeside gown was owned by Padmé Amidala, Queen and later Senator of the planet Naboo, as part of her extensive wardrobe. It was a backless gown that clasped around her neck, and had an ombré of yellow, pink, and purple from collar to hem.

Amidala wore the gown on visits to the Varykino retreat in Naboo's Lake Country. At the end of her second term as queen, she was on retreat there with her handmaidens when they received an unexpected visit by Supreme Chancellor Palpatine, who wished to discuss the outcome of Nute Gunray's third trial for his role in the Trade Federation's blockade and invasion of their homeworld. As they had not anticipated guests, Rabé and the other handmaidens had not packed the Queen's usual formal attire, leaving the lakeside gown as the fanciest one available.
During her retreat with Anakin Skywalker, she wore the dress with her back uncovered.

The lakeside gown was first seen in the 2002 prequel trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones, and was created by costume designer Trisha Biggar. Author E. K. Johnston confirmed via a Tumblr blog post that the lakeside gown worn by Amidala in Queen's Shadow is intended to be the same dress, which she called the "Lake Dress" in the blog post.
